resources.string: Grab destination packages for your family and friends!
We provide itinerary creator that allows you to build your own itinerary!
The easiest way to know nearby restaurants, transportation and more!
This is TARA Alarm clock. This is where you store your Schedules.
Tap on the button below to pick a time for the notification to be sent
Remind yourself, you might forget something
The text you enter below will be shown as the notification title. Leave blank for default title.

TARA offers package 1, which consists of different tourist attractions. From nature wonders to interesting historic sites, museums and once-in-a-lifetime experiences. Check out the following tourist attractions in Quezon City, Philippines.
Art in Island allows visitors to interact and have fun with the art pieces. You can take as much pictures and videos as you want!. Here in Art in Island we want you to BE PART OF ART!
also known as National Shrine of Our Lady of the Holy Rosary of La Naval de Manila, is the largest church in Metro Manila and one of the biggest churches in Asia.
This large circular park is good place to go for a morning walk or jog or simple for stroll. It also has a museum at the center dedicated to the city founder, Manuel L. Quezon.
QCX is an interactive and socio-cultural green building compliant city museum which was inaguarated in Quezon Memorial Circle.
Circle of Fun is a kids theme park, it has lots of rides and other attractions available for kids to enjoy. People typically spend up to 2 hours here.
The stadium was built in honor of former mayor of Quezon City, Norberto S. Amoranto. It has a track and field oval, a volleyball court, a tennis court, and a swimming pool.

Approximate Duration : 
10 Hrs/day (From 10 AM - 8 PM). 
Approximate Cost 
Php 3500 - 5500 ,good for 4 - 6 person

TARA offers package 2, which consists of different tourist attractions. From nature wonders to interesting historic sites, museums and once-in-a-lifetime experiences. Check out the following tourist attractions in Quezon City, Philippines.
Balara Filter park is one of the oldest of Quezon City park. It has swimming pools, a picnic grove, a windmill park, and art deco buildings.
UPTC is a shopping center in Quezon City, Metro Manila and managed by the Ayala Mall Group.
Sta. Maria Dela Strada Parish is a Wedding Church located in Katipunan Ave.
The Ateneo Art Gallery is widely recognized today as the first museum of Philippines modern art, showcases works by postwar Filipino artists.

TARA offers package 3, which consists of different tourist attractions. From nature wonders to interesting historic sites, museums and once-in-a-lifetime experiences. Check out the following tourist attractions in Quezon City, Philippines.
It is a perfectly located along the way giving chances to people to at lease pay visit in the church.
The latest food community to hit Quezon City, it features 12 new food concepts housed and backyard picnic style dining.
The Church of Gesu is the Roman Catholic church of the Ateneo de Manila University campus in Quezon City in the Philippines.
The Philippines premier institution of higher learning. Links to all autonomous units and system-wide updates.
Your 24/7 destination for shopping dining and entertainment.

TARA offers package 4, which consists of different tourist attractions. From nature wonders to interesting historic sites, museums and once-in-a-lifetime experiences. Check out the following tourist attractions in Quezon City, Philippines.
A memorial dedicated to people deemed as heroes during the Martial Law period and People Power Revolution.
Wildlife Rescue Center is like a mini zoo, If you want to gauge whether your little one is ready for his first ever zoo visit.
The church frequent for Sunday mass because it is private subdivision. The service is solemn and the choir singers are great.
It provides a perfect setting for all sorts of econmic educational tours whose most significant task would be present the numerous fascinating and amazing facts to everyone.
When it comes to all things underground, Cubao Expo is the deal. It’s the hub for all things hip and cool, from cheap eats to quirky art, from novelty items to indie music.

TARA offers package 5, which consists of different tourist attractions. From nature wonders to interesting historic sites, museums and once-in-a-lifetime experiences. Check out the following tourist attractions in Quezon City, Philippines.
Sining Kamalig is a gallery of contemporary art. Drop by to enjoy the beautiful and interesting changing exhibition of Filipino artists.
The best garden wedding venue in the Philippines today. The most popular wedding events venue here in Metro Manila.
The museum provides an overview of the Philippine army. You will be able to see arms and weapons and get and idea of the history of the AFP.
Mystery Manila is the first live role playing game in the Philippines. It is an activity that allows people to try something new and challenging.
A place that is very peaceful. You can pray and praise God. A place where you can talk to God and solemnly worship.
The park was a central feature of Baguio when the city was first planned and developed as a retreat for the US military, and remains today as a beloved landmark.
This beautiful structure has twin spires and is one of the most photographed buildings in the city.
The grotto is a favorite pilgrimage site during Holy Week most especially during Holy Thursday and Good Friday. Access to the top of the grotto could be made by climbing the 252 steps.
From the observation deck of the park a breathtaking panoramic view of Benguet gold and copper mines and the surrounding mountains unfolds before you.

The elaborate main gate of the Mansion is said to be a replica of that at Buckingham Palace in London. With its beautiful gardens and a well-manicured lawn, it is a favorite site for sightseeing and picture taking.

The village is said to capture the ethnic spirit and cultural legacy of the Igorots and being tranquil and quiet, it is a nice place to just sit down and relax, take a leisurely stroll along its narrow and winding pathways.
Its main features are a shallow elongated rectangular body of water known as the "Pool of Pines" and the park circle which is on one end of the park.
Camp John Hay used to be the rest and recreational facility for employees of the military and Department of Defense of the United States.
The Philippine Military Academy (PMA) boasts of a long and illustrious history of preparing only the best Filipino men and in recent times, women for military service.
Picking fresh strawberries is one of the most awesome experiences on the outskirts of Baguio. It is a fun activity for your family, especially for the kids.
Artworks by BenCab and other noted Filipino artists, plus indigenous northern highlands exhibits.
This is the center of the compound where you will usually find people waiting to be served by the salesclerks of a small store.
The Baguio Country Club hails from an immensely rich history of more than one hundred colorful years in the hospitality industry.
Session Road is the main thoroughfare of Baguio City and its commercial center, with a variety of shops, stores and offices lining each side.
Bell House, historic vacation home, surrounded by a nice manicured garden and pine trees at Camp John Hay Historical Core.
Small museum with displays and artifacts related to local indigenous groups and the history of the city.
Adventure park offering zip-lining courses along with treetop climbs and cable car rides.
These are natural beauties that can satisfy our love for nature. The natural hot water in Asin bubbles up from the below the ground continuously.
It is commonly said that a trip to Baguio City would not be complete without taking home a souvenir photograph with the famous lion head which serves as the backdrop on Kennon Road.

Dominican Hill was usually the next stop for visitors who go to the Lourdes Grotto since it was just nearby. The hill was well visited not only by local and foreign tourists but also by the residents of Baguio because of the panoramic view it provided of the city.

The Bell Church is located north of the downtown area of Baguio along the road leading to the town of La Trinidad, Benguet. Within its compound are intricately designed arches and buildings adorned with flags, bells and dragons.
he camp is a training center for teachers from all over the country who come to Baguio during the summer time to enroll in special courses in education.
The Baguio City Orchidarium is the place for fresh plants that are sold at an affordable price.
the most popular access to Baguio City, Philippines. There has been no other road that has meant so much happiness for many travelers.
Rizal Park, also known as Luneta Park, is a historic urban park located in the heart of Manila, the capital city of the Philippines.
Casa Manila Museum chronicles the social history of Manila during the Spanish Colonial era.

Officially known as the Manila Metropolitan Cathedral-Basilica, it is the seat of the Archibishop of the Archdiocese of Manila, who is normally regarded as the Roman Catholic Primate of the Philippines.
The Manila American Cemetery in Manila. A final resting place for those that gave the ultimate sacrifice.
The historic centre and oldest district of Manila, the capital city of the Philippines.
The Bahay Tsinoy Museum is a don\'t-miss stop for history-minded visitors to Manila and for those of Chinese heritage.
The Plaza de Armas is a public square in Intramuros, Manila. It is one of two major plazas in Intramuros, the other being the central Plaza de Roma and is the central plaza of Fort Santiago.
Binondo is the "Chinatown" district in Manila. It became the center of commerce during the American occupation.
Manila Bay is a natural harbour which serves the Port of Manila (on Luzon), in the Philippines.
Manila Chinese Cemetery is like stepping into another dimension in time that is both Chinese and Filipino.
One of Manila’s best-known landmarks, Quiapo is the home of the Black Nazarene, an image of Christ believed to be miraculous.
The San Sebastian Church in Manila, Philippines was the first all-iron church in the world; the first all-iron structure in Asia.
Ayala Triangle Gardens is the ideal spot for people who want to distance themselves from the everyday hustle bustle to relax, unwind and get in touch with nature.
SM Mall of Asia is a tourist destination that has raised the standard of shopping, leisure and entertainment in the Philippines.
It serves as one of the educational centers in the country where the viewing public can observe, discover and learn interesting facts about the beauty of Philippine fauna and flora.

This is basically the place where every Filipino dancer would want to perform, where every Filipino indie movie director would want to showcase his film, and where every Filipino opera singer would want to sing his heart out.
Paco Park was originally designed as a municipal cemetery for the affluent and aristocratic families during the Spanish era.
The oldest church in the Philippines. The massive facade conceals an ornate interior filled with objects of great historical and cultural merit.
Star City is the Philippines\' only all-weather, air-conditioned amusement park.It is now bigger and better with its new expansion that comes with 3 new classic rides and more attractions on the way.
The National Museum of the Philippines is the repository and guardian of the Philippines\' natural and cultural heritage.
The Coconut Palace was one of Imelda Marcos\' great white elephant projects in the 1970s. It was so named because of the extensive use of coconut building materials in its construction.
Manila Ocean Park is the country\'s first world-class marine theme park and a premiere educational facility.

The Museo Pambata is a children\'s interactive museum, the first of its kind in the Philippines. It is in a sense an alternative to the formal classroom environment where learning resembles a one-way street.
